title: 6000contestsidewindered 3
content:

{{**[[span style="color:green"]][✔] Biometric verification complete. Welcome back, O5-13.[[/span]]**}}
[[/=]]
[[=]]
[[collapsible show="You have (1) new unread proposal!" hide=" "]]

[[div class="email"]]
[[div class="material-box" style="margin-bottom: 2px;"]]
[[>]]
**{{[[size 125%]]PROJECT CAESURA@@   @@[[/size]]}}**
[[/>]]
----
[[<]]
[[size 80%]]**Project Co-developer(s):** Drs. S. Blom, A. Koppel, H. Nazaryan, and J. Lim, Department of Paragenetics[[/size]]

**ABSTRACT:** //Project Caesura// is a means of totally containing SCP-6942 in its current state or any future iteration via an artificially induced GK-Class ("Hostile Greenhouse") Event, while preserving non-anomalous genetic and paragenetic material for subsequent restoration.

Several physical and digital DNA banks containing samples from every identified species will be constructed and installed at secure Sites worldwide. Any and all genetic material entering these banks will have their paragenome reconstructed and/or purged of any anomalous paragene combinations to ensure the absence of paragenes that may contribute to SCP-6942 during the restoration phase. 

Following the conclusion of the assembly of these banks, a carefully selected series of anomalies under Foundation containment will be activated with the explicit purpose of terminating all life on Earth, inducing an artificial GK-Class ("Hostile Greenhouse") Event. //[[[http://www.scpwiki.com/scp-2000|Protocol 6942-Piedmont]]]// will be activated shortly after //Project Caesura// is initiated via on-site AI. 

Upon successful deployment, life on Earth, and effectively human civilization, will be restored to a state consistent with what it was on 01/01/1980, prior to the occurrence of any hypothesized macromutative event.
[[/<]]
[[table style="width: 100%;"]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="border-top: 1px solid #AAA; border-right: 1px solid #AAA; text-align: left; width: 75%;"]]
//Area-313 Deep Storage, one of the candidate sites for installation of a DNA bank.//
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border-top: 1px solid #AAA; text-align: center; width: 25%;"]]
[[image Svalbard_seed_vault_IMG_8887.jpg size="100%"]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]
 
----
[[<]]
**ADDITIONAL NOTES**: By joint recommendation of the O5-Council and the Ethics Committee, isolated static paragenes correlated with sapience are to be preserved within the human genome. 

[[/<]]
----
Please vote in the table below.
||~ In Favor ||~ Abstained ||~ Against||
||  @@ @@ ||  @@ @@ ||  @@ @@ ||
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[/=]]

[[/=]]

[[div class="email"]]
[[div class="tofrom"]]
[[<]]
**To:** oco5-02@scipnet.scp, oco5-03@scipnet.scp, oco5-04@scipnet.scp, oco5-05@scipnet.scp, and 8 others
**From:** oco5-01@scipnet.scp
**Date:** 01/09/2022
**Subject:** Re Project Caesura Voting Results
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[<]]
------
Fellow Council Members,

The results of the vote on moving forward with Project Caesura have been collected. The proposal has been passed by unanimous vote. Preparations will begin shortly.

Regards,
O5-01

**Attachment: Voting Results**
[[/<]]
[[div class="addendum" style="background: #fff url('https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme%3Ai57/scp-logo-i57.png') center center no-repeat; border: solid 1px #000000; padding: 15px 15px; box-shadow: 0 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2); width: 84%; margin: 4% 4% 4% 4%"]]

[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="email"]]
[[div class="tofrom"]]
[[<]]
**To:** oco5-13@scipnet.scp
**From:** oco5-09@scipnet.scp
**Subject:** Re:SCP-6942 and Related Macromutatory Event
**Date:** 01/09/2022
[[/<]]
[[/div]]

[[<]]
O5-13,

I think I've found what you're looking for. It looks like your hypothesis was indeed correct. 

The macromutatory event occurred as a secondary anomaly during the last GK Event, the one in the North Sea. Went undetected due to limited manpower at Yellowstone. Only humanoids were affected and as a result we redirected efforts toward efficacy in the Lazarus Procedure. Never thought to check those damn bugs, did we?

We'll get them this time, I suppose.

Regards,
O5-09
[[/<]]
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
author: Aftokrator
